cui_name: Nonmedullary thyroid carcinoma, with or without cell oxyphilia
reasoning: Nonmedullary thyroid carcinoma (papillary, follicular, anaplastic) accounts for ~90-95% of all thyroid cancers. Global thyroid cancer incidence from GLOBOCAN 2005 was ~1.6-1.8 per 100k; NMTC represents majority. The 'with or without cell oxyphilia' qualifier describes HÃ¼rthle cell features within these histological subtypes, not a separate category. Reporting incidence of new cases per 100k person-years.
